title: COVID-19 Public Education Campaign
sitename: US Department of Health and Human Services
cleaned_text: Increase Awareness, Increase Protection We all know someone 50 or older — a family member, neighbor, colleague at work. And many of them don't know that the risk of COVID death increases as you age. Take a look at the resources below and share them with others to help protect your community. Resources About Long COVID Outreach resources about Long COVID and how to prevent it. [See Resources](https://wecandothis.hhs.gov/resource/resources-about-long-covid) Addressing Vaccine Misconceptions Tools to help you respond to common misconceptions about COVID-19 and the vaccines. [See Resources](https://wecandothis.hhs.gov/outreach-tools/addressing-covid-19-vaccine-misconceptions) CDC Guidance and Recommendations The latest authoritative information from CDC to guide your outreach efforts. [Get the Latest](https://wecandothis.hhs.gov/resource/updated-cdc-masking-guidance) Join the Corps to get tips, tools, and resources to share. [Sign Up](https://wecandothis.hhs.gov/covidcommunitycorps) Take action by participating in the weekly challenge to make a difference. [Take Action](https://wecandothis.hhs.gov/community-call-to-action) New and Featured Resources [COVID Facts: Free Vaccines](/resource/covid-facts-free-vaccines) An animated video explaining that the best time to get a COVID vaccine is now, while they're still free. [ The Story Behind the First COVID Vaccination with Dr. Kizzmekia Corbett and Dr. Sandra Lindsay](/campaign-ad/the-story-behind-the-first-covid-vaccination-with-kizzmekia-corbett-and-sandra-lindsay) A conversation between Dr. Kizzmekia Corbett, lead scientist in the development of the first COVID vaccine, and Dr. Sandra Lindsay, the registered nurse who was the first person in the U.S. to get an authorized vaccine. [Social Media Posts About COVID-19 Vaccines ](https://wecandothis.hhs.gov/resource/social-media-posts-for-covid-19-vaccine-boosters) Social media messages for organizations to share to encourage people to stay up to date with their COVID vaccines. About the Campaign The HHS COVID-19 public education campaign is a national initiative to increase public confidence in and uptake of COVID-19 vaccines while reinforcing basic prevention measures such as mask wearing and social distancing. The campaign also increases awareness about COVID treatments and heightens urgency to talk to a doctor at first sign of symptoms.
